news.title: The Saw Doctors announce Dublin and Belfast Shows
news.summary: They will play Dublin’s 3Olympia on November 28 and Belfast’s Ulster Hall on December 12.

news.title: Album Review: Sabrina Carpenter, Man's Best Friend
news.summary: Album of the Month: Delightful hedonism from queen of provocative pop . 8/10

news.title: Franz Ferdinand announce headline tour with Dublin and Belfast dates
news.summary: Tickets will go on sale on Friday, September 12.

news.title: Book Review: Living In The Present With John Prine
news.summary: The hardback edition will be published on September 18

news.title: Lizzo surprise releases MY FACE STILL HURTS FROM SMILING
news.summary: Listen to the new mixtape below.

news.title: Dundalk Institute of Technology: Home to an innovative range of programmes and state-of-the-art facilities
news.summary: As part of our Student Special, we're highlighting some of the diverse learning opportunities available to you...

news.title: King Kong Company announce show at The Academy
news.summary: They will also play Cyprus Avenue in Cork with tickets still available.

news.title: IMMA Earth Rising festival to take place this weekend featuring Negro Impacto, EFÉ, Ispíní na hÉireann and more
news.summary: It will feature over 50 free events at the Royal Hospital Kilmainham celebrating “creativity, ideas, and grassroots solutions for a changing world.”

news.title: On this day in 1992: Tom Waits released Bone Machine
news.summary: 33 years ago today, Tom Waits released his groundbreaking, Grammy Award-winning 11th studio album, Bone Machine. To celebrate, we're revisiting our original 1992 album review – and sharing some special reflections from The Murder Capital's Damien Tuit...

news.title: Tributes pour in following the passing of “patron saint of Irish music” Liam Norton
news.summary: “Liam Norton was one of the most passionate people we’ve ever had the pleasure of knowing throughout this crazy journey,” Enola Gay said.
